20110105220814.000|20110105220816.000|TR0|try to make government more honest, 
20110105220816.000|20110105220818.000|TR0|accountable and responsive.  Republicans 
20110105220818.000|20110105220820.000|TR0|contend they can do all of that by 
20110105220820.000|20110105220822.000|TR0|changing the rules of the House.  And 
20110105220822.000|20110105220824.000|TR0|they're wasting no time trying to make 
20110105220824.000|20110105220827.000|TR0|that happen.
20110105220827.000|20110105220829.000|TR0|
20110105220829.000|20110105220831.000|TR0|Our Congressional correspondent, Brianna 
20110105220831.000|20110105220833.000|TR0|Keilar, is here in THE SITUATION ROOM 
20110105220833.000|20110105220835.000|TR0|following this part of the story -- rules, 
20110105220835.000|20110105220837.000|TR0|sounds boring, but this is critically 
20110105220837.000|20110105220839.000|TR0|important stuff.
20110105220839.000|20110105220841.000|TR0|
20110105220841.000|20110105220844.000|TR0|BRIANNA KEILAR, CNN CONGRESSIONAL 
20110105220844.000|20110105220846.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:  It is.  And it's pretty 
20110105220846.000|20110105220848.000|TR0|interesting.  Four key rule changes here.
20110105220848.000|20110105220850.000|TR0|
20110105220850.000|20110105220852.000|TR0|First, Wolf, all of the bills that will be 
20110105220852.000|20110105220854.000|TR0|submitted for approval, they have to be 
20110105220854.000|20110105220856.000|TR0|accompanied by a statement that explains 
20110105220856.000|20110105220859.000|TR0|why they are Constitutional.  Republicans, 
20110105220859.000|20110105220901.000|TR0|especially Tea Party members, have argued 
20110105220901.000|20110105220903.000|TR0|that Democrats have gone beyond the 
20110105220903.000|20110105220905.000|TR0|Constitution.  And they say this is to 
20110105220905.000|20110105220907.000|TR0|make sure that they stay within the lines.
20110105220907.000|20110105220909.000|TR0|
20110105220909.000|20110105220911.000|TR0|Now, also, there is a new 72-hour rule.  
20110105220911.000|20110105220914.000|TR0|Bills will have to be online for three 
20110105220914.000|20110105220916.000|TR0|full days before a final vote.  This gives 
20110105220916.000|20110105220918.000|TR0|the public a chance to read them and voice 
20110105220918.000|20110105220920.000|TR0|their concerns or support.  This, 
20110105220920.000|20110105220922.000|TR0|Republicans say, is in the name of 
20110105220922.000|20110105220924.000|TR0|transparency and opinions.
20110105220924.000|20110105220926.000|TR0|
20110105220926.000|20110105220928.000|TR0|And check this out.  The House of 
20110105220928.000|20110105220931.000|TR0|Representatives finally entering the 
20110105220931.000|20110105220933.000|TR0|technological age -- BlackBerries, iPads, 
20110105220933.000|20110105220935.000|TR0|laptops.  They are allowed now on the 
20110105220935.000|20110105220937.000|TR0|House floor, as long as they don't impair 
20110105220937.000|20110105220939.000|TR0|decorum.  That is part of the rule.
20110105220939.000|20110105220941.000|TR0|
20110105220941.000|20110105220943.000|TR0|And, finally, the Budget Committee 
20110105220943.000|20110105220946.000|TR0|chairman gets some extra authority under 
20110105220946.000|20110105220948.000|TR0|these rules.  Republicans say this is a 
20110105220948.000|20110105220950.000|TR0|response to Democrats not passing a budget 
20110105220950.000|20110105220952.000|TR0|last year.  This is a new rule that would 
20110105220952.000|20110105220954.000|TR0|allow the chairman to unilaterally set 
20110105220954.000|20110105220956.000|TR0|spending limits on a temporary basis if 
20110105220956.000|20110105220958.000|TR0|the House doesn't act.  This actually 
20110105220958.000|20110105221001.000|TR0|reverts to the way things were when

20110105222929.000|20110105222931.000|TR0|ANDY HOOVER, ACLU OF PENNSYLVANIA:  It's 
20110105222931.000|20110105222934.000|TR0|unconstitutional.  State legislators do 
20110105222934.000|20110105222936.000|TR0|not have the power to simply circumvent 
20110105222936.000|20110105222938.000|TR0|the constitution at their will and there 
20110105222938.000|20110105222940.000|TR0|are enough smart folks here at our state 
20110105222940.000|20110105222942.000|TR0|legislatures who understand that.  They 
20110105222942.000|20110105222944.000|TR0|understand it's an extreme position to 
20110105222944.000|20110105222946.000|TR0|take and I'm confident they won't move 
20110105222946.000|20110105222949.000|TR0|this forward.

20110105225712.000|20110105225714.000|TR0|red-winged blackbirds from Arkansas could 
20110105225714.000|20110105225716.000|TR0|hold the key to a disturbing puzzle.  
20110105225716.000|20110105225718.000|TR0|Working with the birds inside what's 
20110105225718.000|20110105225720.000|TR0|called a bio-safety cabinet, Dr. Kevin 
20110105225720.000|20110105225722.000|TR0|Keel begins to try to determine what 
20110105225722.000|20110105225725.000|TR0|killed them.  And not just these birds, 
20110105225725.000|20110105225727.000|TR0|but thousands of others New Year's Eve.
20110105225727.000|20110105225729.000|TR0|
20110105225729.000|20110105225731.000|TR0|The cabinet is a precaution just in case 
20110105225731.000|20110105225733.000|TR0|the birds were the victims of some 
20110105225733.000|20110105225735.000|TR0|disease.  Scientists don't think so, but 
20110105225735.000|20110105225737.000|TR0|let's let the doctor explain as he begins 
20110105225737.000|20110105225740.000|TR0|the exam.
20110105225740.000|20110105225742.000|TR0|
20110105225742.000|20110105225744.000|TR0|DR. KEVIN KEEL, UGA WILDLIFE RESEARCHER:  
20110105225744.000|20110105225746.000|TR0|And I'm looking and palpating for any 
20110105225746.000|20110105225748.000|TR0|broken bones, and feeling the bones in the 
20110105225748.000|20110105225750.000|TR0|wing, trying to tell if there are any 
20110105225750.000|20110105225752.000|TR0|fractures.  I'm looking for hemorrhages.  
20110105225752.000|20110105225755.000|TR0|Sometimes if birds fly into things, you 
20110105225755.000|20110105225757.000|TR0|may see hemorrhages in the mouth and may 
20110105225757.000|20110105225759.000|TR0|see fractures of the beak.  And the 
20110105225759.000|20110105225801.000|TR0|evidence we have so far suggests that this 
20110105225801.000|20110105225803.000|TR0|was a traumatic event.
20110105225803.000|20110105225805.000|TR0|
20110105225805.000|20110105225807.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  Traumatic event, as in the birds 
20110105225807.000|20110105225809.000|TR0|ran into something -- something hard.  The 
20110105225809.000|20110105225812.000|TR0|lab has already dissected and x-rayed the 
20110105225812.000|20110105225814.000|TR0|Louisiana birds, and the internal damage 
20110105225814.000|20110105225816.000|TR0|suggests the birds likely died as the 
20110105225816.000|20110105225818.000|TR0|result of a collision.
20110105225818.000|20110105225820.000|TR0|
20110105225820.000|20110105225822.000|TR0|DR. JOHN FISHER,  UGA WILDLIFE RESEARCHER: 
20110105225822.000|20110105225824.000|TR0| This tells us that these birds probably 
20110105225824.000|20110105225827.000|TR0|flew into inanimate objects which caused 
20110105225827.000|20110105225829.000|TR0|the trauma. We looked for evidence of 
20110105225829.000|20110105225831.000|TR0|gunshot injuries with the radiographs and 
20110105225831.000|20110105225833.000|TR0|didn't see any.  And so they may have 
20110105225833.000|20110105225835.000|TR0|flown into anything from buildings or 
20110105225835.000|20110105225837.000|TR0|power lines, or towers, or it could have 
20110105225837.000|20110105225839.000|TR0|flown into the ground, as well.  SAVIDGE:  
20110105225839.000|20110105225842.000|TR0|Power lines are thought to be to blame in 
20110105225842.000|20110105225844.000|TR0|Louisiana.  In Arkansas, it was noted the 
20110105225844.000|20110105225846.000|TR0|bird deaths occurred near where they roost 
20110105225846.000|20110105225848.000|TR0|for the night.  Simply put, something 
20110105225848.000|20110105225850.000|TR0|startled them, possibly fireworks since it 
20110105225850.000|20110105225852.000|TR0|was New Year's Eve, and the birds took off 
20110105225852.000|20110105225854.000|TR0|panicked into the darkness.
20110105225854.000|20110105225856.000|TR0|
20110105225856.000|20110105225859.000|TR0|KEEL:  The weather in that area last 
20110105225859.000|20110105225901.000|TR0|night, the night of the mortality event, 
20110105225901.000|20110105225903.000|TR0|was overcast.  There was a little bit of 
20110105225903.000|20110105225905.000|TR0|rain so that there was a low ceiling.  It 
20110105225905.000|20110105225907.000|TR0|wasn't foggy, but it still may have 
20110105225907.000|20110105225909.000|TR0|resulted in some disorientation of the 
20110105225909.000|20110105225911.000|TR0|birds and contributed to them flying into 
20110105225911.000|20110105225914.000|TR0|objects.
20110105225914.000|20110105225916.000|TR0|
20110105225916.000|20110105225918.000|TR0|(END VIDEOTAPE)
20110105225918.000|20110105225920.000|TR0|
20110105225920.000|20110105225922.000|TR0|SAVIDGE:  Scientists don't think the two 
20110105225922.000|20110105225924.000|TR0|events in the two different states are 
20110105225924.000|20110105225926.000|TR0|related.  They also are taking tissue 
20110105225926.000|20110105225929.000|TR0|samples.  They will send them out for 
20110105225929.000|20110105225931.000|TR0|further study to make sure it's not some 
20110105225931.000|20110105225933.000|TR0|sort of disease, not some sort of chemical 
20110105225933.000|20110105225935.000|TR0|and not poisoning.  They'll get the
